page.title: 03CLUBS: W.I. AND RIFLE
page.content: { Women's Institute:}The W.I., founded in 1897, is now the largest organisation for women in England. It aims to help the community by assisting with fund-raising events etc. and generally improving the quality of life for country women. The monthly meetings begin with the hymn 'Jerusalem' and include films and handicraft sessions. Broadwell W.I. has 26 members and Oddington W.I. has 27. {Broadwell Rifle Club:}The club, formed 40 years ago, meets in the village hall. Members from a 12 mile radius travel as far as Bristol to compete. Four contestants, wearing padded shoulder jackets, lie on mats in a darkened room and using 18lb guns fire live bullets at illuminated targets at the far end of the hall. The guns are kept locked away in a strong room.
